Dir Data Analytics Data ScienceYour Tasks And ResponsibilitiesThe primary responsibilities of this role, Director, Data Analytics Data Science HEOR/RWE/RWD , are to: Lead the development and implementation of Data Generation & Observational Studies (DG&OS) HEOR data analyses for the Bayer product portfolio;
Assist in leading the review of research protocols and the development of statistical analysis plans for HEOR analyses;
Design and conduct data analyses for research with the highest standard of rigor and scientific accuracy. Includes study design, methodology, algorithms and statistical modeling;
Assist in the quality control (QC) process of databases licensed by DG&OS to ensure accuracy of the data source that DG&OS is using as a basis for our cost effectiveness work;
Lead the evaluation of new data sources, ensuring that the relevant processes, entities, relationships, and data flows have been identified and addressed;
Partner with the DG&OS HEOR Research team to anticipate data and research needs into the future;
Train new members in the team and mentor across the team to continue to maintain the high efficiency of this HEOR Data Analytics group;
Assist Senior Director in strategy development across the multiple departments that are supported by the Data Analytics group;
This role will be residence based in the US.
Visa sponsorship may be offered for this role. Who You AreYour success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE (Leadership Integrity Flexibility Efficiency) values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:Required Qualifications: Masters or PhD in Biostatistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field;
Demonstrated expert level experience with large healthcare databases (e.g., Optum and MarketScan Claims and Optum Electronic Health Records [EHR]);
Demonstrated expert level understanding of analytic methodologies and statistical modeling;
Demonstrated expert level experience in SAS;
Demonstrated extensive experience performing HEOR analyses in a pharmaceutical company;
Demonstrated extensive knowledge and skill in analytic platform server architecture (Snowflake, UNIX, LINUX) design;
Excellent communication skills and good understanding in the multi-cultural corporate environments;
This position requires a minimum 10% travel. Preferred Qualifications: Minimum 7 years of progressive experience in real world database analytics;
Minimum 7 years of experience in statistical programming with statistical software (SAS) in the pharmaceutical industry.
Experience in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence especially in Regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, and Neural Network models, among others;
Experience in programming analytics studies in R and/or Python;
Drives efficiencies through innovative technology design; Employees can expect to be paid a salary b etween $141000 to $195000 . Other compensation may include a bonus or commission (if relevant). Additional benefits include health care, vision, dental, retirement, PTO, sick leave, etc.. If selected for this role, the offer may may vary based on an applicant’s location, market data/ranges, an applicant’s skills and prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications, and other relevant factors. YOUR APPLICATION Bayer offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and want to impact our mission Science for a better life, we encourage you to apply now. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer.To all recruitment agencies: Bayer does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.Bayer is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/VeteransBayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.IMPORTANT NOTE for POTENTIAL US CANDIDATES: Bayer expects its employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Bayer active employees are also expected to disclose their vaccination status and if fully vaccinated, provide proof of vaccination status to Occupational Medicine. Bayer defines fully vaccinated in alignment with CDC which is two weeks after completing the two-dose vaccine regimen or two weeks after completing the one-dose regimen.
